com.github.robtimus.junit.support.io

Interface InputStreamTests

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    InputStreamTests.AvailableTests, InputStreamTests.MarkResetTests, InputStreamTests.ReadByteTests, InputStreamTests.ReadIntoByteArrayPortionTests, InputStreamTests.ReadIntoByteArrayTests, InputStreamTests.SkipTests

    public interface InputStreamTests
    Base interface for testing separate InputStream functionalities.
    Author:
    Rob Spoor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  InputStreamTests.AvailableTests
      Contains tests for InputStream.available().
      static interface  InputStreamTests.MarkResetTests
      Contains tests for InputStream.mark(int) and InputStream.reset().
      static interface  InputStreamTests.ReadByteTests
      Contains tests for InputStream.read().
      static interface  InputStreamTests.ReadIntoByteArrayPortionTests
      Contains tests for InputStream.read(byte[], int, int).
      static interface  InputStreamTests.ReadIntoByteArrayTests
      Contains tests for InputStream.read(byte[]).
      static interface  InputStreamTests.SkipTests
      Contains tests for InputStream.skip(long).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] expectedContent()
      Returns the expected content from created input streams.
      InputStream inputStream()
      Returns the input stream to test.

    • Method Detail

      • inputStream

        InputStream inputStream()
        Returns the input stream to test.

        This method will be called only once for each test. This makes it possible to initialize the input stream in a method annotated with BeforeEach, and perform additional tests after the pre-defined test has finished.

        Returns:
        The input stream to test.

      • expectedContent

        byte[] expectedContent()
        Returns the expected content from created input streams.
        Returns:
        The expected content.
